Sections.Text: January 17, 1934. Opening night at The Museum of Occult Antiquities, presented by The Tyree Trust.
The undying sorcerer Ses-kalla has walked the Earth since he was ousted from the throne in ancient Sumer.
He is driven by an eternal desire to be reunited with his dead love, Nuratum, whom he dreams of someday restoring to life.
The new museum opened by the Tyree Trust hosts scores of ancient artifacts Ses-kalla has spent centuries searching for. Now they are all under one roof.

Long practiced in disguising himself amongst mortal men, Ses-kalla, has entered the museum in the form of a normal patron. He must secretly gather as many artifacts as possible before he is discovered.
The museum's heavily armed and observant staff are on guard against supernatural threats, and will be watching for any suspicious behavior.
Ses-kalla can start the Ritual of Renewal to bring back Nuratum at any time, but once he does, he will be immobile and vulnerable.
The more artifacts he finds, the faster the ritual and the more tomb guardians he can summon to his aid.
If Ses-kalla can trick the security team into attacking an innocent patron, then the offending security team member will be arrested and removed from the museum.
But if he is attacked by security while in disguise, Ses-kalla will be forced to start the ritual immediately.
